actor_awards.notes: Nominated for a BAFTA for Best Foreign Actress for 'Viva Maria!' Won the David di Donatello Award for Best Foreign Actress for 'The Truth' (1960). Received an Honorary César Award in 1985. Known as 'B.B.', she was a major sex symbol of the 1950s and 60s before retiring to become an animal rights activist.

filmography.title: The Truth (La Vérité)
filmography.role_description: A young woman on trial for the murder of her lover, facing societal judgment for her liberated lifestyle.
filmography.plot: A young woman is on trial for the murder of her lover. As the trial progresses, her life story and the events leading up to the crime are revealed through flashbacks.
filmography.awards: David di Donatello: Win – Best Foreign Actress

filmography.title: Contempt (Le Mépris)
filmography.role_description: The disillusioned wife of a screenwriter who becomes contemptuous of him when he seems to use her to advance his career.
filmography.plot: Screenwriter Paul Javal's marriage to his wife Camille disintegrates during movie production as she spends time with the producer.

filmography.title: Masculin Féminin
filmography.role_description: Bardot appears as herself in a scene within a cafe, reading a script.
filmography.plot: Paul, young and idealistic, chases budding pop star Madeleine, as they and their friends navigate the cultural and political shifts of 1960s Paris.

filmography.title: Royal Affairs in Versailles (Si Versailles m'était conté)
filmography.role_description: A minor role as a courtier in Sacha Guitry's historical epic.
filmography.plot: A series of historical vignettes portraying the history of the Palace of Versailles and the French monarchs who lived there.

filmography.title: The Grand Maneuver (Les Grandes Manœuvres)
filmography.role_description: A photographer's daughter who is one of the women in the lieutenant's circle.
filmography.plot: A cavalry lieutenant makes a bet that he can seduce a divorced milliner before his regiment leaves town.

filmography.title: In Case of Adversity (En cas de malheur)
filmography.role_description: A young female thief who becomes the mistress of the older lawyer defending her.
filmography.plot: A distinguished lawyer risks his career and marriage when he falls obsessed with his young, criminal client.
filmography.awards: Victoires du cinéma français: Win – Best Actress

filmography.title: Act of Love (Un acte d'amour)
filmography.role_description: A young French woman who has a tragic romance with an American soldier.
filmography.plot: An American soldier in Paris falls in love with a lonely, destitute French girl, but his commanding officer forbids them to marry.

filmography.title: The Light Across the Street (La Lumière d'en face)
filmography.role_description: A sensual young wife whose husband's health issues lead to tension and jealousy.
filmography.plot: A truck driver marries a young woman but is unable to consummate the marriage due to an injury, leading to a tense triangle with a neighbor.

filmography.title: Dear Brigitte
filmography.role_description: Bardot appears as herself, the object of a young boy's fan mail and affection.
filmography.plot: An eccentric professor's son, a math prodigy, develops a crush on Brigitte Bardot and sends her fan letters, eventually meeting her in Paris.

filmography.title: And God Created Woman (Et Dieu... créa la femme)
filmography.role_description: A sexually liberated young orphan who disrupts the lives of three men in St. Tropez.
filmography.plot: A free-spirited teenager in St. Tropez marries one brother but desires another, causing scandal and conflict in the village.
filmography.awards: Bambi Awards: Nomination – Best Actress - International

filmography.title: Viva Maria!
filmography.role_description: An anarchist's daughter who teams up with a circus singer (Jeanne Moreau) to lead a revolution.
filmography.plot: Two women named Maria meet in Central America and become revolutionaries, leading a peasant uprising.

filmography.title: Come Dance with Me! (Voulez-vous danser avec moi?)
filmography.role_description: A wife who goes undercover as a dance instructor to clear her husband of a murder charge.
filmography.plot: A woman investigates a murder at a dance school to prove her husband's innocence.

filmography.title: The Bear and the Doll (L'Ours et la Poupée)
filmography.role_description: A high-strung, wealthy woman who crashes her car into a cellist's vehicle and disrupts his quiet life.
filmography.plot: A cellist's quiet life is turned upside down when he collides with a capricious, wealthy woman.

filmography.title: Spirits of the Dead (Histoires extraordinaires)
filmography.role_description: A woman in the 'William Wilson' segment who plays a card game against the cruel protagonist.
filmography.plot: An anthology of three Edgar Allan Poe stories, dealing with guilt, lust, and the macabre.

filmography.title: La Parisienne (Une parisienne)
filmography.role_description: The daughter of the French President who tries to make her husband jealous by flirting with a visiting prince.
filmography.plot: The daughter of the French President marries her father's secretary but feels neglected, so she tries to make him jealous.

filmography.title: Babette Goes to War (Babette s'en va-t-en guerre)
filmography.role_description: A naive country girl who inadvertently becomes a resistance fighter and spy during WWII.
filmography.plot: A young French woman flees to England during WWII and is parachuted back into France on a secret mission.

filmography.title: Helen of Troy
filmography.role_description: The handmaiden to Helen, a smaller role that helped introduce her to international audiences.
filmography.plot: The Trojan prince Paris falls in love with the Spartan queen Helen, sparking a war between the two nations.

filmography.title: Plucking the Daisy (En effeuillant la marguerite)
filmography.role_description: A general's daughter who enters a striptease contest to pay for a rare book.
filmography.plot: A general's daughter flees to Paris and enters a striptease contest to raise money, hiding her identity.

filmography.title: Naughty Girl (Cette sacrée gamine)
filmography.role_description: A troublesome schoolgirl who is suspected of being a blackmail threat.
filmography.plot: A cabaret owner is asked by the police to look after the daughter of a counterfeiter, who turns out to be a handful.

filmography.title: Doctor at Sea
filmography.role_description: A French singer on a ship who becomes the love interest of the ship's doctor.
filmography.plot: A young doctor signs on as a medical officer on a cargo ship to escape his dominating girlfriend.

filmography.title: The Night Heaven Fell (Les Bijoutiers du clair de lune)
filmography.role_description: A young woman who falls in love with a man who killed her uncle.
filmography.plot: A young woman falls for a man who is on the run after killing her uncle in self-defense.

filmography.title: A Very Private Affair (Vie privée)
filmography.role_description: A young woman who becomes a movie star and struggles with the lack of privacy, a role mirroring Bardot's own life.
filmography.plot: A young woman becomes a movie star and sex symbol, but fame brings misery and a lack of privacy.

filmography.title: Shalako
filmography.role_description: A European countess hunting in the Wild West who is rescued by a cowboy.
filmography.plot: A cowboy must rescue a party of European aristocrats who have wandered into Apache territory.

filmography.title: The Female (La Femme et le Pantin)
filmography.role_description: A temptress who manipulates a man's affections.
filmography.plot: A French woman toys with the affections of a wealthy man, leading to his ruin.

filmography.title: Love on a Pillow (Le Repos du guerrier)
filmography.role_description: A wealthy woman who saves a suicidal man and enters a destructive relationship with him.
filmography.plot: A young woman saves a man from suicide and becomes trapped in a turbulent and abusive relationship with him.

filmography.title: Boulevard du Rhum (Rum Runners)
filmography.role_description: A silent film star who becomes the object of a rum runner's affection.
filmography.plot: A rum runner during Prohibition falls in love with a silent film actress he sees on screen and meets in person.
